result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph F Lapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph F Lapp

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept. of Revenue mailed to Defendant, along w/JFFO.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Character letter in support of the defendant.

Case called at 3:05pm [mo]
Defendant Joseph F Lapp in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; submits victim impact statement

On State's Request to submit Amended Information:
--argument given by ADA Teuber
--the Court grants the State's request

Atty. Zarwell admits service and waives reading of Amended Information.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.



On Counts #1 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  7/22/16 at   7:00pm.
--to finds out who hunters safety instructor was and write letter of apology
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons or ammunition as defined by statute
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs



Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 3:39pm
from Parties requesting relief from Court's scheduling order

Case called at 8:30am [mo]
Defendant Joseph F Lapp in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

The Court reviews the Co-Actor's case.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
--allow 2 days for trial

The Court distributes its scheduling order.
recess: 8:38am

NEXT:   (1) FSSC on 5/23/16 at 3:00pm   (2) Jury Trial on 6/2 AND 6/3/2016 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:04 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Joseph F Lapp in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Lapp waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State submits information for wrong case - indicates that It does not have file - requests arraignment at later date - information returned as it was not marked
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:07 pm

NEXT: (1) Arriagnment scheduled for 2/22/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Joseph F Lapp in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Zarwell request a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Clerk announces the Preliminary Hearing date.
recess: 9:03am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 1/26/16 at 1:00pm
Defendant's Demand & Motion for Discovery and Inspection, with Fax Cover Sheet

Cases 15CF283 and 15CM309 called together at 3:08pm [mo]
Co-Defendant Joseph F Lapp in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   
Co-Defendant Lukas J. Lapp in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF283(Joseph Lapp):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with NSH (dob 11/3/1997)
--No Contact with ACW (dob 12/21/1997)
--No Contact with CJF (dob 1/4/1998)
**An exception to contact with the above listed persons would be as required by school for extracurricular activities or as instructed by teachers or coach
**The Court allows discussion about room arrangements/cleanliness with CJF (dob 1/4/1998). 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with the co-actor 
--no possession of a dangerous weapon as defined by statute
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today.


As to Case 15CM309(Lukas Lapp): 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with NSH (dob 11/3/1997)
--No Contact with ACW (dob 12/21/1997)
--No Contact with CJF (dob 1/4/1998)
--no discussion of the facts of the case with the co-actor 
--no possession of a dangerous weapon as defined by statute
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today.
recess: 3:24pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference as to 15CF283(Joseph Lapp) on 10/28/15 at 10:20am  //Pretrial Conference as to Case 15CM309(Lukas Lapp)on 10/28/15 at 10:40am      (2)  As to both Cases: Status Conference on 12/8/15 at 9:00am
